intro: Malvastrum gracile, commonly known as slender mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
